title: Github Copilot: Your account has exceeded GitHub's API rate limit. Please try again later.
body:
Type: Bug On the MahmutVG account, GitHub Copilot disconnects after a single question. The extension shows the following error: "Your account has exceeded GitHub's API rate limit. Please try again later." This happens immediately after the first Copilot interaction, which suggests something abnormal with the rate-limiting behavior. Steps to Reproduce: Sign in with the MahmutVG account. Open VS Code with the GitHub Copilot extension enabled. Ask Copilot one question. Copilot disconnects and displays the API rate limit error. Expected Behavior: Copilot should allow continuous use within the normal request limits for an authenticated account. Actual Behavior: Copilot disconnects after one question with an API rate limit warning. Questions / Clarification Needed: Why is Copilot triggering a rate limit after only one request? Is there an authentication or token misconfiguration with the MahmutVG account? Could this be linked to an account-level restriction or a Copilot service issue? Account: MahmutVG Tool: GitHub Copilot in VS Code Extension: GitHub.copilot and GitHub.copilot-chat enabled Authentication: Signed in with GitHub account Extension version: 0.31.2025082801 VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.104.0-insider (Universal) (7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c, 2025-08-28T05:03:17.163Z) OS version: Darwin arm64 24.4.0 Modes:

title: Files Changed Panel in VSCode Copilot
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Hello GitHub Copilot Team,

I am a regular user of Copilot Chat in Visual Studio Code and have encountered a persistent UI issue that impacts my workflow. In the Copilot Chat pane, there is a "files changed" panel that displays a list of recently modified files. This panel is positioned directly between the chat input area (where I type messages to Copilot) and the chat response area (where I read Copilot’s replies).

Currently, there is no option to hide, collapse, or move this "files changed" panel. Its fixed position takes up valuable vertical space and makes it more difficult to communicate with Copilot, especially on smaller screens. Resizing the chat pane affects both the input and response areas, but does not allow me to minimize or remove the "files changed" panel independently.

I would like to request the following improvements:

Add an option to hide, collapse, or move the "files changed" panel in the Copilot Chat interface.
Allow users to customize the layout of the Copilot Chat pane for a cleaner and more efficient chat experience.
This change would greatly improve usability for users who prefer a streamlined chat interface and do not need to see the list of changed files at all times.

Thank you for considering this feature request!

Best regards,
larryweberplasma

title: Fix debug status bar color to use theme-appropriate blue instead of error-like orange
body:
The status bar color during debugging sessions was using an error-like orange/reddish color (`#CC6633`) that made it appear as if an error had occurred, rather than indicating normal debug mode. This was particularly problematic in the Light+ theme where the orange color was visually jarring and inconsistent with the theme's design.

## Changes

- Updated `STATUS_BAR_DEBUGGING_BACKGROUND` to reference `STATUS_BAR_BACKGROUND` instead of hardcoded `#CC6633`
- This changes the debug status bar to use the theme-appropriate blue color (`#007ACC`) for both Light+ and Dark+ themes
- Preserved existing high contrast colors for accessibility (`#BA592C` for dark HC, `#B5200D` for light HC)
- Added test coverage to prevent regression

## Before/After

**Before:** Orange/reddish status bar during debugging that looks like an error state
**After:** Blue status bar during debugging that matches the regular status bar theme color

This provides a more consistent user experience where debug mode appears intentional rather than problematic, aligning with VS Code's design principles.

Fixes #175694.

>

title: Fix tree view collapsible toggle keyboard accessibility when inactive
body:
Tree view collapsible toggles (twisties) were remaining keyboard-focusable even when they were inactive, creating accessibility issues. This occurred in scenarios like empty tree views or for leaf nodes that cannot be expanded/collapsed.

## Problem
When using keyboard navigation (Tab key), users could focus on collapsible toggle icons even when they had no function:
- Empty tree views still had focusable toggles
- Leaf nodes without children had focusable toggles
- Screen reader users encountered non-functional controls

![Tree view showing the issue](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/90be1dca-1756-4b03-823d-3c78b2036ee6)

## Solution
Modified the `renderTreeElement` method in `AbstractTree` to manage the `tabIndex` property based on the collapsible state:

```typescript
if (node.collapsible && (!this.hideTwistiesOfChildlessElements || node.visibleChildrenCount > 0)) {
    // Twistie is functional - make it keyboard accessible
    templateData.twistie.tabIndex = 0;
} else {
    // Twistie is not functional - remove from tab order
    templateData.twistie.tabIndex = -1;
}
```

## Impact
- **Improved accessibility**: Non-functional controls are no longer focusable via keyboard
- **Better UX**: Tab navigation skips inactive elements
- **Screen reader friendly**: Assistive technologies won't encounter non-functional controls
- **Consistent behavior**: Follows existing VS Code patterns for `tabIndex` management

## Testing
- Added unit test to verify correct `tabIndex` values for both collapsible and non-collapsible twisties
- Verified the fix works across all tree implementations (WorkbenchAsyncDataTree → AsyncDataTree → ObjectTree → AbstractTree)
- Tested with empty trees, leaf nodes, and dynamic state changes

Fixes #263684.

title: Remove VSCODE_SUGGEST from terminal environment setup
body:
This PR removes the `VSCODE_SUGGEST` environment variable from the terminal environment setup as requested in the issue. The environment variable was being set in two locations within the shell integration injection logic but was not actually being used by any of the shell integration scripts.

## Changes Made

1. **Removed environment variable setup**: Eliminated the two instances where `envMixin['VSCODE_SUGGEST'] = '1'` was being set in `getShellIntegrationInjection()` for both Windows PowerShell and Unix PowerShell scenarios.

2. **Updated documentation**: Removed the reference to manually setting `VSCODE_SUGGEST` from the terminal suggest configuration description, as this is no longer necessary.

## Background

The `VSCODE_SUGGEST` environment variable was originally set when `options.shellIntegration.suggestEnabled` was true, but investigation showed that:
- The variable is not referenced in any of the shell integration scripts (PowerShell, bash, zsh, fish)
- Terminal suggestion functionality works through other mechanisms
- The variable serves no functional purpose and can be safely removed

All other shell integration environment variables (`VSCODE_INJECTION`, `VSCODE_STABLE`, etc.) remain unchanged, ensuring existing functionality is preserved.

Fixes #263800.

title: fix: ensure SVG images are loaded before clipboard copy
body:
Fixes intermittent clipboard copy failures for SVG output where users
encountered "No blob data to write to clipboard" errors. The issue was
caused by a race condition where canvas operations proceeded before
the dynamically created Image element finished loading the SVG data URL.
- Add ensureImageLoaded helper to wait for image load completion
- Handle both already-loaded and loading states
- Include error handling and 5-second timeout protection
- Maintain backward compatibility with existing image copy functionality

Fixes: #265020

title: Copilot consistently tries running commands in busy terminal
body:
Copilot will repeatedly try running commands in a busy terminal, such as if it has spawned a dev server.

I had it investigate and came up with the following for the repo's copilot instructions .md file:

````
## Testing changes

### Running commands in terminal

**CRITICAL**: If current terminal is BUSY (running a command), `isBackground: false` commands will NOT execute until that terminal is free. You must spawn a new terminal by running a command with `isBackground: true`.

- `isBackground: false` - Uses current terminal, waits for completion
- `isBackground: true` - Creates NEW terminal, returns immediately

**Working pattern:**

```bash
bun run dev          # isBackground: true (starts server in NEW terminal A)
curl localhost:3000  # isBackground: true (creates NEW terminal B for curl)
curl localhost:3000  # isBackground: false (runs in current terminal B)
```

**Wrong pattern:**

```bash
bun run dev          # isBackground: false (blocks current terminal forever)
curl localhost:3000  # isBackground: false (will never execute - terminal is busy)
```
````

It seems like this should still be addressed though, as it's likely others will run into this issue, and it's not easy to get copilot to follow these instructions all the time.

The terminal behavior should be made more obvious. copilot should be unable to run commands on busy terminals (and perhaps only send ctrl signals)

title: [WIP] Error "Failed to fetch MCP registry URL" in dev console
body:
- [x] Analyze the error "Failed to fetch MCP registry URL" in dev console
- [x] Identify the root cause: HTML error responses being parsed as JSON
- [ ] Improve error handling in getMcpRegistryProvider method
- [ ] Add proper HTTP status code checking before JSON parsing
- [ ] Include response content in error messages for better debugging
- [ ] Add telemetry for MCP registry fetch failures
- [ ] Test the fix with mock scenarios
- [ ] Validate TypeScript compilation

The issue occurs when the MCP registry URL returns an HTTP error response (like 401, 404, etc.) with HTML content instead of JSON. The current code tries to parse this HTML as JSON using the `asJson` function, which throws an error with limited debugging information.

The fix involves:
1. Adding proper HTTP status checking in the `getMcpRegistryProvider` method
2. Providing more detailed error messages that include the HTTP status code and response content
3. Adding appropriate telemetry to track these failures for better monitoring

Fixes #263568.

title: Maintain line breaks in transform to Camel and Pascal case actions
body:
Fixes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/261387.

# Transform to Camel Case

## Single line transformations

I split this in two cases. When a single line (without line breaks) is selected, the behavior remains unchanged. I did this because I noticed unit tests that assert that white space characters should be considered as valid word boundaries.

Example
```
"camel from words" -> "camelFromWords"
``` 

## Multiline transformations

On the other hand, in case of a selection spanning multiple lines I changed the relevant regex to only consider `_` and `-` as valid word boundaries. Effectively guaranteeing correct transformations only when coming from kebab or snake case. 

I did this because considering tabs as word boundaries will break the indentation for a code block. And as @RedCMD suggested, I also think it makes sense to treat `a-b c-d` as separate words (-> `aB cD`).

# Transform to Pascal Case

Here I was much more conservative because this transformation has some extra logic to capitalize the first letter of a word
```ts
return words.map((word: string) => word.substring(0, 1).toLocaleUpperCase() + word.substring(1))
			.join('')
```
Therefore not using spaces and tabs as word boundaries would execute the above logic on spaces and tabs. It was easier to just address the line break problem here and not get lost in edge cases.

# Testing
I added some unit tests, and this should be straightforward to test manually 🙌🏻 


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1c4f2b3b-e5a7-4916-bc37-4541e8683b6b

title: Implement custom ESLint rule to disallow spread operator for performance
body:
This PR implements a custom ESLint rule `code-no-spread-operator` that warns against the use of the spread operator (`...`) and suggests performance-optimized alternatives.

## Motivation

The spread operator, while convenient, can have performance implications in performance-critical codebases like VS Code. This rule helps developers choose more explicit and potentially faster alternatives.

## Implementation

The rule detects and warns against spread operator usage in four contexts:

### 1. Array spread operations
```typescript
// ❌ Flagged by the rule
const combined = [...arr1, ...arr2];

// ✅ Suggested alternatives
const combined = arr1.concat(arr2);
// or using VS Code's utility
import { pushMany } from 'vs/base/common/arrays';
```

### 2. Object spread operations
```typescript
// ❌ Flagged by the rule
const merged = { ...obj1, ...obj2 };

// ✅ Suggested alternative
const merged = Object.assign({}, obj1, obj2);
```

### 3. Function call spread
```typescript
// ❌ Flagged by the rule
const result = myFunc(...args);

// ✅ Suggested alternative
const result = myFunc.apply(null, args);
```

### 4. Constructor call spread
```typescript
// ❌ Flagged by the rule
const instance = new MyClass(...args);

// ✅ Suggested alternative (refactor to avoid spread)
```

## Real-world impact

The rule will catch existing patterns in the codebase such as:
```typescript
// From src/vs/base/common/actions.ts:209
out = [...out, new Separator(), ...list];
```

And suggest using VS Code's existing utilities like `pushMany()` from `vs/base/common/arrays.ts` or standard alternatives like `Array.concat()`.

## Configuration

- The rule is automatically loaded through the existing `.eslint-plugin-local` infrastructure
- Configured as `'local/code-no-spread-operator': 'warn'` in the main ESLint configuration
- Applies to all TypeScript and JavaScript files in the project

## Note on scope

The rule specifically targets spread syntax in expressions, not rest parameters in function signatures (which remain unaffected and continue to be valid patterns).

title: [Insiders] Just updated my VSCode and now i can't use it. Memory Leak ?
body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No - VS Code Version: 1.104.0-1756358443 (code-insiders) - OS Version: Ubuntu 22.04 (precisly PopOS 22.04) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Had vscode opened, so i closed all tabs from the system manager 2. Ran apt update && apt upgrade -y 3. After it completed i opened vscode again. When i reopened vscode the memory just went up and up and up filling ~20GB memory + 20GB swap 2s after open : 15s after: and everything froze. My guess are the /proc/self/exe that are in fault, but idk what are thoses for now.

title: Copilot is unusable at best, harmful at worst
body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes Version: 1.103.2 (user setup) Commit: 6f17636121051a53c88d3e605c491d22af2ba755 Date: 2025-08-20T16:45:34.255Z Electron: 37.2.3 ElectronBuildId: 12035395 Chromium: 138.0.7204.100 Node.js: 22.17.0 V8: 13.8.500258-electron.0 OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Ask Copilot to do anything 2. Watch it do nothing related to what you asked for 20 minuted while it just wastes your tokens This is outrageous- I cannot use copilot for anything. Simple requests like "Please move the copy icon to sit on the border of this chat bubble" results in an insane 20 minute excursion of this thing which ends up with it breaking my entire codebase. It can't even format code correctly, let alone solve a simple problem. This is GPT-5, too, so there is NO REASON for this to be happening- this is purely a tooling issue- not a model issue. I don't know what kind of tooling you guys have going on here, but take a page from Anthropic's book, and figure it out already. It's like you're living in 2023.

title: Copilot Chat initially fails with "Maximum call stack size exceeded", then floods output with "Failed to fetch indexing status" errors
body:
Type: Bug **Summary** Following the GitHub API service disruption on [August 27, 2025](https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/x7gtw6r3x2s1), the GitHub Copilot Chat extension is failing to function correctly. On startup, the extension was unresponsive and threw a `Maximum call stack size exceeded` error. After partially recovering, it now exhibits continuous `TypeError: fetch failed` errors related to code indexing, appears to be heavily rate-limited (HTTP 429), and the remote WSL extension host is unstable. **Key Findings from Logs** Analysis of the full VS Code logs reveals several concurrent issues: * **Confirmation of Call Stack Error:** The logs confirm the `RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded` error originating from the Copilot Chat extension (`extension.js`), matching the initial symptom. ```log 2025-08-28 12:07:45.739 [error] [Extension Host (Remote)] RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded at HF.trace (/home/david/.vscode-server-insiders/extensions/github.copilot-chat-0.31.2025082801/dist/extension.js:462:1858) ... ``` * **Authentication Rate Limiting (HTTP 429):** The `GitHub Authentication` provider is repeatedly failing with `429 Too Many Requests`. This is the likely root cause of the `fetch failed` errors, as the extension is being blocked from making further API calls. ```log 2025-08-28 12:07:27.445 [info] [GitHub Authentication] fetching: Node fetch failed with status: 429 Too Many Requests ``` * **WSL Connection Instability:** The connection to the remote extension host in WSL is frequently timing out and reconnecting. This instability could be triggering repeated authentication and initialization cycles, contributing to the rate-limiting problem. ```log 2025-08-28 12:08:11.406 [info] [Window] [remote-connection][ExtensionHost][bf243…][reconnect] received socket timeout event... ``` * **Broader Extension Host Errors:** Multiple extensions, including `ms-vscode-remote.remote-wsl`, `github.copilot-chat`, and `deque-systems.vscode-axe-linter`, are throwing a `PendingMigrationError: navigator is now a global in nodejs`. This suggests a potential incompatibility with the current VS Code Insiders build's environment that may be exacerbating the issue. --- ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Have Visual Studio Code running with the GitHub Copilot and GitHub Copilot Chat extensions installed and authenticated in a WSL environment. 2. Use the extensions normally. (The issue was potentially triggered by the GitHub API service disruption on August 27, 2025: [githubstatus.com](https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/x7gtw6r3x2s1)). 3. Close VS Code completely. 4. Wait for some time, then re-launch VS Code and connect to the WSL project. 5. Open the GitHub Copilot Chat panel from the activity bar. 6. **Observe (Initial State):** The chat interface is unresponsive and does not load. It only displays the default "Ask about your code." message. 7. Navigate to the Extensions view (`Ctrl+Shift+X`), find the "GitHub Copilot Chat" extension, and open its details page. 8. Select the **Runtime Status** tab. 9. **Observe:** The "Uncaught Errors" section displays instances of "Maximum call stack size exceeded," as shown in the attached screenshot and confirmed in logs. 10. Wait for several minutes. The Chat UI may become responsive on its own. 11. Open the Output pane (`View > Output`). 12. In the dropdown menu on the right of the Output pane, select "GitHub Copilot". 13. **Observe (Current State):** The output pane is continuously filled with errors like `CodeSearchRepoTracker::getIndexedStatus(...). Failed to fetch indexing status. Encountered eror: TypeError: fetch failed`. Extension version: 0.31.2025082801 VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.104.0-insider (7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c, 2025-08-28T05:03:17.163Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes: Remote OS version: Linux x64 6.6.87.2-microsoft-standard-WSL2

title: feat(ts-codeLens): show "implementations" CodeLens for overridden methods
body:
### Summary
This PR adds support for showing **"implementations" CodeLens** on TypeScript methods that are overridden in derived classes.

### Changes
- Extended `TypeScriptImplementationsCodeLensProvider` to surface implementations for:
  - Class methods (not just interfaces or abstract methods)
  - Overridden methods in derived classes
- Updated `extractSymbol` logic to correctly identify these symbols
- Added smoke test: `implementationsCodeLens.test.ts` to validate behavior

### Why
Resolves [#198387](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/198387).

Developers can now see `"1 implementation"` / `"n implementations"` CodeLens above methods that are overridden, and navigate directly to their derived class implementations.  
This aligns CodeLens behavior with the **“Find All Implementations”** command.

### Verification
- Open an abstract/base class with a method that is overridden in derived classes.
- Confirm that the `"implementations"` CodeLens appears above the method.
- Clicking it navigates to the derived class overrides.

### Testing
- **Local build & compile successful**
- **Hygiene checks passed**
- **Smoke test added & executed**
- **Integration tests run successfully** (`scripts/test-integration.bat`)

### Notes
This improvement makes CodeLens more consistent and increases productivity when working with object-oriented TypeScript codebases.

---

Fixes #198387

title: fix: move product.overrides resolution to an earlier stage
body: product values used within `main.ts` before [startup](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c/src/main.ts#L203), ex: `product.dataFolderName` in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c/src/main.ts#L436  don't get the values from override since resolution of the file happens in `bootstrap-esm`. This came up as a bug, when we tried to read an incorrect argv file in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7a1d7c43a322fb4827197a05ea9e088d23ee542c/src/vs/code/electron-main/app.ts#L1427

title: Tabs & quick Navigation between chats for the panel chat view (like for editor chats)
body: Can we please get tabs for our ai chat view, and the ability to quickly navigate between chat tabs? (Cursor)

title: Agent mode not working screenshots

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body: VS Code Version: 1.103.2 (Universal) OS Version: macOS 15.6.1 (24G90) Steps to Reproduce 1. Open Visual Studio Code. 2. Attempt to sign in to GitHub Copilot. 3. Click Continue with GitHub when prompted. 4. Browser opens GitHub authorization window. 5. After confirming the account, the redirect goes to a blank local page (127.0.0.1). 6. VS Code shows: "You have not yet finished authorizing this extension to use GitHub. Would you like to try a different way? (url handler)" 7. Clicking Yes opens another GitHub page where I can select my account again. 8. Nothing happens, and I remain signed out. Expected Behavior After confirming my GitHub account, VS Code should complete authentication and sign me into GitHub Copilot. Actual Behavior 1. Redirects to a blank local IP page (127.0.0.1). 2. VS Code repeatedly prompts that authorization is unfinished. 3. After retrying, the GitHub page allows account selection, but the login never completes. Screenshots Attached are screenshots of the full flow: 1. GitHub authorization prompt. 2. Warning in VS Code about unfinished authorization. 3. "Signing in to github.com..." message. 4. Blank 127.0.0.1 redirect page. 5. Copilot sign-in looping back. Additional Info - Issue occurs in Agent Mode and normal mode. - Reproduced with all extensions disabled (--disable-extensions). - Stable internet connection.

title: Add a global enable/disable field for tools in mcp.json

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I would like to request adding a field to mcp.json that allows globally enabling or disabling individual tools. This would make it possible to fully disable a tool without deleting or commenting out its configuration. Currently, commenting out configuration is not reliably synchronized and may be lost, making it hard to manage tools with complex parameters. Some mcp setups provide many tools, and VS Code limits agents to a maximum of 128 tools, making this feature even more necessary for managing large configurations.

---

for example:
```jsonc
{
		"playwright": {
			"command": "npx",
			"args": [
				"@playwright/mcp@latest"
			],
			"type": "stdio",
			// add an option to disable the mcp server but it can still be synced
			"disabled": true
		}
}
```
